topic.title: GFP-F Filtering

body.p: The GFP-F filtering will drop all client frames with PTI not matching Data frames (PTI=0), CMF frames (PTI=4), and MCF frames (PTI=5).

Client data frames that match per-channel configurable EXI and UPI values will be forwarded. Frames that mismatch the EXI or UPI/PTI values will generate a dEXI and dUPM defect indications, respectively. GFP CMF frames for loss of client signal (UPI = 0x1, CSF-LOS), loss of character synchronization (UPI = 0x2, CSF-LOCS), FDI (UPI=0x4, CSF-FDI) and RDI (UPI = 0x5, CSF-RDI) are processed to optionally generate consequential actions as per Figure 4 . The CSF-FDI, CSF-RDI, CSF-LOS and CSF-LOCS contributions to the dCSF defect are configurable with only CSF-RDI not contributing by default.
